OPEN DAY
If you are considering applying to Abertay University
column2: then attending an organised visit such as our Open Day is the best way to see what we have on offer. Our Open Day includes an opportunity to find out more about the course you are interested in
column3: see our facilities and talk to staff.

column1: APPLICANT INFORMATION DAYS 2007

Submitting an application for entry in September 2007? Applicant Information Days are held on Wednesday afternoons between January and May 2007 and are by invitation only. They are designed to provide you with specific information on our courses and are aimed at those who have already applied to Abertay through UCAS to commence study in September 2007. You will automatically be invited to attend one of our Applicant Information Days if you have applied through UCAS. Invitations are sent out from the end of December onwards.
INDIVIDUAL VISITS
Wherever possible we encourage you to attend an Open day
column2: where you can find out all you need to know about life as a student at Abertay. If you are unable to attend one of the Open days
column3: we may be able to arrange an individual visit subject to staff availability. Individual visits can include a visit to the department to discuss the course and/or a tour of the campus. To allow us to explore the availability of an individual visit we ask you to give us at least two week's notice. Please contact us on +44 (0)1382 308080.

column1: INFORMATION TALKS

The Student Recruitment Office carries out a range of talks throughout the year in local schools and colleges. We can offer a subject specialist to come to your school or college to talk about the UCAS application procedure
column4: student life or on a number of academic disciplines e.g. food & consumer sciences
column5: sociology or the internet to name but a few. If your school feels that you would benefit from an Abertay talk
column6: please contact the Student Recruitment Office:
